meanings.definition: A word, letter, or number placed before another.
meanings.sent1: In the word 'unhappy', 'un-' is a prefix.
meanings.sent3: I always remember a prefix as the little word that comes before the big word.
meanings.sent4: Adding a prefix is like putting a tiny hat on a word.
meanings.sent5: The prefix 're-' can make a word mean 'again'.

meanings.definition: To add a prefix to a word.
meanings.sent1: Remember to prefix your username with 'Mr'.
meanings.sent2: I will prefix the title with 'Dr.' before your name.
meanings.sent3: I like to prefix my passwords with my favorite number.
meanings.sent4: She decided to prefix her email with a smiley face.
meanings.sent5: You can prefix the word 'happy' with 'un-' to make 'unhappy'.
